intro: Pycreus squarrosulus, commonly known as the roughleaf pycreus, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming umbels that are usually greenish-white in color. The plant has a fibrous root system and is known for its aromatic properties. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the wild.
